clinical_study.brief_title: Correlation of Endoscopic Findings and Symptoms in Patients Undergoing the First Upper Gastrointestinal Endoscopy
clinical_study.official_title: Correlation of Endoscopic Findings and Symptoms in Patients Undergoing the First Upper Gastrointestinal Endoscopy

lead_sponsor.agency: Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine

clinical_study.source: Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: Endoscopy is the best means of finding early stage of upper gastrointestinal diseases, especially early cancer and benign ulcers. Currently, most people still undergo upper gastrointestinal endoscopy due to discomfort, rather than a regular physical examination at a certain age. This study prospectively investigated the reason for undergoing the first upper gastrointestinal endoscopy in patients and found the correlation of endoscopic findings and symptoms.

primary_outcome.measure: Correlation of endoscopic findings and symptoms
primary_outcome.time_frame: Within two weeks after receiving the survey

secondary_outcome.measure: The proportion of various symptoms in patients undergoing the first upper gastrointestinal endoscopy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within two weeks after receiving the survey

secondary_outcome.measure: The proportion of different upper gastrointestinal diseases
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within two weeks after receiving the survey
secondary_outcome.description: Diagnosis of upper gastrointestinal disease combined with endoscopic findings and pathological diagnosis.

secondary_outcome.measure: The infection rate of Helicobacter Pylori
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within two weeks after receiving the survey
secondary_outcome.description: H. pylori infection was determined by any two of positive outcome of the breath test, rapid urease test and histology.

intervention.description: All endoscopy was performed by qualified gastroenterologists or endoscopic physicians in Renji hospital,Shanghai Jiaotong University School of Medicine.

study_pop.textblock: Patients undergoing the first upper gastrointestinal endoscopy were collected from January 2018 to December 2018 in Renji Hospital, Shanghai Jiaotong University School of Medicine.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing the first upper gastrointestinal endoscopy.
Exclusion Criteria:
- The patients had previously performed endoscopy and any esophageal, gastric or duodenal surgery.
- The patients couldn't complete the questionnaire survey under the guidance of physicians at the appointment of the upper gastrointestinal endoscopy.
